alert.note: Alert for Clay; Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 1:23PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Jefferson, southeastern Cotton, northern Clay and southeastern Wichita Counties through 215 PM CST... At 122 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Wichita Falls, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Wichita Falls, Burkburnett, Henrietta, Iowa Park, Petrolia, Byers, Dean, Jolly, Sheppard AFB, northern Lake Arrowhead, Pleasant Valley, Charlie and Cashion. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
